basics.name: Ciem Cornelissen
basics.label: PhD Researcher in Computer Science Engineering
basics.summary: PhD researcher at IDLab (Ghent University - imec) specializing in AI-driven precision agriculture and environmental monitoring. Expertise in hyperspectral imaging, deep learning, and multi-modal sensor fusion for autonomous systems.

work.name: IDLab, Ghent University - imec
work.summary: Research on adaptive sensor fusion for autonomous systems, with focus on precision agriculture. Development of LISA (Light-Invariant Spectral Autoencoder) and OHSLIC algorithm for hyperspectral imaging analysis.
highlights: Published in IEEE IoT Journal, WACV, and Neural Computing and Applications
Created efficient UAV-based phenotype segmentation algorithms

education.area: Computer Science Engineering - AI and Sensor Fusion

publications.name: In-Field Mapping of Grape Yield and Quality with Illumination-Invariant Deep Learning
publications.summary: Development of the LISA framework for illumination-invariant hyperspectral imaging analysis in precision viticulture. An end-to-end IoT-enabled robotic system for non-destructive, real-time mapping of grape yield and quality.

publications.name: Adaptive Clustering for Efficient Phenotype Segmentation of UAV Hyperspectral Data
publications.publisher: IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV) Workshops
publications.summary: Introduction of the OHSLIC algorithm for computationally efficient, real-time phenotype segmentation from hyperspectral imaging data. Enables on-device processing on UAVs.

publications.name: Computational Fairness in Adaptive Neural Networks
publications.summary: A novel investigation into the fairness of adaptive neural networks, analyzing disparities in computational resource allocation across demographic subgroups. Introduces computational resource allocation as a new dimension of AI fairness.
